meanings.definition: A large number of things that are put one on top of another
meanings.sent1: The pileup of books on the shelf was starting to lean.
meanings.sent2: The kids created a pileup of blocks in the playroom.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally caused a pileup of laundry on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The pileup of dishes in the sink seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The pileup of leaves in the yard needed to be cleared before winter.

meanings.definition: A situation in which a number of vehicles crash into each other
meanings.sent1: The highway was closed due to a massive car pileup.
meanings.sent2: The foggy conditions led to a dangerous pileup on the freeway.
meanings.sent3: The pileup on the racetrack caused chaos among the drivers.
meanings.sent4: The sudden snowstorm resulted in a pileup of cars on the road.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise signaled another pileup at the intersection.

meanings.definition: To accumulate or increase in quantity
meanings.sent1: The dishes started to pileup in the sink.
meanings.sent2: If you don't clean regularly, dust will pileup on the furniture.
meanings.sent3: I tend to let my emails pileup in my inbox.
meanings.sent4: The paperwork began to pileup on my desk.
meanings.sent5: Problems can pileup if you don't address them promptly.
